results.firPara: Saints have lost yet another top-rated manager to an English club but despite such a grim outlook, Claude Puels arrival may be just the fillip the club need
results.secPara: Saints have lost yet another top-rated manager to an English club but despite such a grim outlook, Claude Puels arrival may be just the fillip the club need
results.webTitle: Premier League 2016-17 preview No13: Southampton | Jacob Steinberg

results.firPara: Frank de Boer has been confirmed as Internazionales new head coach following Roberto Mancinis departure on Monday.
results.secPara: The 46-year-old Dutchman was formally unveiled by the Serie A club on Tuesday afternoon. He was approached to become the next Internazionale manager after Mancini left by mutual consent because of a breakdown in his relationship with the board.
results.webTitle: Frank de Boer appointed Internazionale head coach on three-year contract
Football transfer rumours: Chelsea beat Arsenal to Mauro Icardi?

results.firPara: A first Olympic football title for the host country looks a distant prospect in Rio after two uninspiring 0-0 draws leave fans in state of despair
results.secPara: Sem jogo, sem gol e sem amor was the verdict in O Globo on Brazils latest Olympic horror, the 0-0 draw with Iraq in Brasilia. No game, no goal, no love. Just an oddly familiar kind of angst and the latest significant staging post in the theatre of pain that has become Brazilian tournament football. In Brasilia the home fans cheered the opposition, chanted the name of Marta and generally continued the theme of domestic meltdown that has gripped this serial host nation in the last two years. Welcome back, o jogo collapsico.
results.webTitle: Brazil’s caravan of angst totters under burden of Olympic obsession | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: • José Mourinho breaks transfer record to sign Juventus midfielder
results.secPara: Manchester United have confirmed the signing of Paul Pogba for a world record fee of €110m (£93.2m) from Juventus, with José Mourinho challenging the France midfielder to be at the heart of this club for the next decade and beyond.
results.webTitle: Paul Pogba: Manchester United confirm record £93.2m signing on five-year deal

results.firPara: Kasper Schmeichel has played down the effect of Leicester City losing NGolo Kanté to Chelsea and believes the Premier League champions will remain a force this season due to an abundance of pace in attacking positions.
results.secPara: Claudio Ranieris team have barely featured in discussions about the coming seasons title race and are only seventh favourites with the bookmakers at 33/1.
results.webTitle: Kasper Schmeichel says Leicester City will remain a Premier League force

results.firPara: The chairman of Kick It Out has urged football to do more to promote community cohesion in the face of a rising tide of hate speech and intolerance exacerbated by the Brexit debate.
results.secPara: Lord Ouseley said that while football should be praised for measures taken inside stadiums to stamp out discrimination, and for its community programmes, it had the power to do much more to combat the effects of a rise in prejudice in the grassroots game and beyond.
results.webTitle: Brexit will increase intolerance outside our football grounds, says Lord Ouseley

results.firPara: They are not in the Champions League but breaking the transfer record to sign a player they let go shows United are still far more interesting than many clubs who are
results.secPara: Manchester United will not see themselves as mugs for paying a world record fee to buy back a player who was on their books four years ago. Instead, their marketing men can present the purchase of Paul Pogba, who signed a five-year deal late on Monday night, as evidence of the clubs enduring power and prestige. United are not in the Champions League this season, but they have ensured, by adding Pogba to a box-office cast that includes José Mourinho and Zlatan Ibrahimovic, they remain more interesting than many clubs who are. Thats showbiz, in which United have a specific role to play. Outbidding Real Madrid is at least as important to them as outperforming Leicester City.
results.webTitle: Manchester United’s signing of Paul Pogba proves they are still box office | Paul Doyle

results.firPara: Crystal Palace have rejected a bid of £18m from Everton for the forward Yannick Bolasie, with the south London club holding out for a fee closer to £30m.
results.secPara: Ronald Koeman has been searching for additions to his squad since succeeding Roberto Martínez as manager in June but so far has signed only the midfielder Idrissa Gueye for £7.1m from Aston Villa and the Holland goalkeeper Maarten Stekelenburg this summer.
results.webTitle: Crystal Palace reject Everton’s £18m bid for Yannick Bolasie

results.firPara: Paul Pogba has passed his medical at Manchester United before his €110m (£93.2m) move from Juventus to the Premier League club.
results.secPara: The 23-year-old flew to Manchester on Monday to be assessed by Uniteds medical staff in order to clear the final hurdle of the summers most high-profile and protracted transfer.
results.webTitle: Paul Pogba passes medical before Manchester United move
